title: How Notion leveraged community to build a $10B business | Camille Ricketts
key_insights: Community led growth works best for freemium products with 'atomic units of sharing' - things users create and want to show off
Content marketing requires 'content market fit' - understanding your audience's pain points as deeply as product market fit
Ambassador programs should start small (20 people) and grow slowly to maintain intimacy and engagement
Net new website visitors is a key metric for measuring brand awareness and discovery efforts
Don't focus on ROI metrics too early for community building - organic fervor is more important initially
High-quality content takes significant time investment - approximately 8-10 hours per piece
Community members should be able to monetize their expertise to create stronger evangelism
Founder belief in community value is essential - it's hard to convince skeptical leadership

guest_background.current_role: Recently departed from Notion (first marketing hire), currently on sabbatical

topics_discussed: Community led growth definition and implementation
First Round Review creation and strategy
Press and PR vs direct communication
Event hosting and in-person community building
memorable_quotes: The way that you think about product market fit, you have to think about content market fit.

True discovery is when you have intent to find out more. You've heard about it so many times or you've been intrigued by something that someone has told you to the extent that you're actually going to take the step of now learning about it.
One of the worst things you can do is say, let's cut this off at the knees if it's not generating ROI when you're seeing organic fervor.
frameworks_mentioned: Two-by-two matrix for community strategy (product market fit vs enterprise/consumer)
Jobs to be done for content (make money, entertain, improve work/life, inform)
recommended_for: marketing leaders at product-led growth companies
summary: Camille Ricketts, Notion's first marketing hire, shares tactical insights on building community-led growth and content marketing strategies that helped scale Notion to a $10B valuation. The conversation covers practical frameworks for when to invest in community, how to structure ambassador programs, and the principles behind successful content marketing.
